pr_title: Adding AWS AssumeRole support to Importer

timeline.message:
Adding AWS AssumeRole support to Importer
 - New properties added for aws sts to get token
 - Reworked s3 client config to use the new credential provider when needed

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Adding documentation to the config md

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Removing unused code

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Adding new config to the helm chart

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: Since these are S3 specific, let's create a public static class S3 nested class and a private final S3 s3 = new S3(); field here to contain them so they have a s3 in their property path.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: No need to pass these parameters since downloaderProperties is a class member. Mixing the two approaches doesn't make sense.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText:
There should be a space after if. Please ensure you:


Install EditorConfig plugin


Install Save Actions plugin


Configure it



Have default IDE code style for Java (editorconfig should provide most formatting)
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Added these settings and fixed the if ( issue
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: Log a statement indicating setting up credentials with AWS Assume Role.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Instead of if statements, it would make more sense to use @ConditionalOnProperty and construct different AwsCredentialsProvider depending upon property values being present. That is, we should have 3 beans of type AwsCredentialsProvider each with different @ConditionalOnProperty. If need be, assume role can be marked primary. It may also make sense to use a nested config class to group by cloudprovider
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: I like the idea, the only ways I can come up to implement it though are either with a conditional expression or an enum to explicitly state which provider to use.  With just ConditionalOnProperty I need a way to specify a property must NOT be present, otherwise the AnonymousCredentialsProvider would get created every time, and I have not found a good way to do that operation.
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText: Would that not still create the anonymous provider if the accessKey is provided?  My understanding of matchIfMissing is it only applies if the property is not provided, so if the keys are provided it will still create both the anonymous and the static providers
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText: That's true. So you'd have to use conditional expression or a custom condition. If that makes the code less readable/simple, I'm okay with current approach.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: I will test out an expression and see how it looks.  All other comments thus far should be addressed now.
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText:
I wrote some custom Condition classes and moved the credentialProvider bean creation into a separate class, with this change it appears to work as expected, let me know if this change is too much.
Also, I have the AssumeRoleCondition only checking for the roleArn, realistically it will need the keys too, but I figure better to throw an exception in the creation logic than have it bump down to the Anonymous creds if those are missing.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: Can this work with anonymous credentials? If not, please throw an error if accessKey or secret key empty.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Removed the call that would allow it to try to use anonymous credentials, and did a check/throw exception if the keys are not provided.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: Code reuse is good, but in this case reusing awsCredentialsProvider() cause a log statement to indicate the wrong credentials were used to setup the client. Also it may not work with anonymous creds. It may be better to just use StaticCredentialsProvider directly.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Good call, removed this and built my own StaticCredentialsProvider.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText:
nit: accessKey, secretKey and region are all pulled from the downloaderProperties which you use in here to get roleArn, roleSessionName and externalId.
Probably no need to pass them in, that was it makes it consistent and makes for a shorter call.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

timeline.message:
Changes for PR comments (documentation and properties rework)

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Addressing PR comments (Config logic change and add exception)

timeline.bodyText: from AWS SDK doc, an assumeRole session has a duration; S3 calls will fail once the session expires. so we also need to support assumeRole session refresh.
timeline.author: xin-hedera

replies.author: ijungmann
